Connecting a small GPS device to the helmet would allow cyclists to navigate without having to hold a phone or use a separate GPS device.
Incorporating a small, integrated water bottle holder would allow cyclists to keep hydrated during their rides without having to carry a separate water bottle.
Attaching a small, foldable bike lock to the helmet would allow cyclists to securely lock their bike to a fixed object, such as a bike rack or sign, while they are taking a break from riding.

Incorporating a small, built-in bell or horn would allow cyclists to use it to signal their presence to other road users, such as pedestrians or motorists, when approaching from behind or crossing intersections.
Adding a small, adjustable neck flap or visor to the helmet would improve comfort and protection for the cyclist's neck and reduce wind noise during high-speed rides.
